creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
inscription:
Signature, Date, Inscription, Stamp

inscribed in plate at top: [HERCVLES MVLTIS BELLIS LACESSIT TROIAM]
markings: pink stamp on verso, lower left: Lawrason Riggs (Lugt 1756c); black stamp on verso, lower left: Robert Scholtz (Lugt 2241). Also on verso: loan number for 1941 Baltimore exhibition.
provenance: Lawrason Riggs, Baltimore; Robert Scholtz, Budapest; Kennedy Galleries, New York; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: monogram in plate at lower right: [HSB]; date in plate at lower left: [1545]
title: Hercules Fighting the Trojans, From the Labors of Hercules
